users.profile: I may live in the future, but my heart's stuck in the '90s with my SNES. Retrogaming isn’t a hobby — it’s a time machine, and I’ve got the controller.
Full of ideas and always up for a challenge, Loïc codes like he’s playing a boss fight: calm, focused, and with the right soundtrack.
Always on the go, Ginji is the kind of player who finishes a Zelda dungeon between two train stops. Quiet, fast, and pixel-perfect.
favorite_games: The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening

users.profile: Yuna blends creativity and logic like a perfect potion. From RPGs to UI design, she’s got mana to spare.
Axel codes like he plays shooters — headshots only. Precision, performance, and no room for lag.
Always a step ahead, Mira sees the code and the fun in everything. Dreamcast fan and dream-team player.

posts.title: Fake API
posts.content: Today, I have developped a small Fake API in PHP.

posts.title: Retrogaming
posts.content:
I may live in the future, but my heart's stuck in the '90s with my SNES.
Nothing beats the thrill of pixelated adventures, chiptune music, and yelling at Mode 7 graphics.
Retrogaming isn’t a hobby — it’s a time machine, and I’ve got the controller.

posts.title: Duck Hunt Devlog
posts.content: Trying to recreate Duck Hunt in JS — turns out, making a dog laugh at you is harder than expected. Still worth it!

posts.title: The Book That Made Me Code
posts.content: Reading 'Clean Code' was like switching from a wooden sword to the Master Sword. Suddenly, bugs started fearing me.

posts.title: When GB Pixels Hit Different
posts.content: There’s something magical about a grayscale Zelda on Game Boy. Low-res visuals, high-res nostalgia.
